title: Suspected Lockerbie bomber charged in three-count indictment
description: The Justice Department says it will not seek the death penalty for a former Libyan intelligence official accused of making the bomb in the 1988 Lockerbie, Scotland, attack where 270 people on Pan Am flight 103 died. The suspect recently appeared in a federal courtroom in Washington, D.C., as he has been charged in a three-count indictment. NBC News’ Ken Dilanian has the latest.

title: Lockerbie bombing suspect makes initial appearance in U.S. court
description: A Libyan man suspected of making the bomb that blew up a passenger plane over Lockerbie, Scotland, in 1988 made his initial appearance in federal court Monday.

title: Peru's new president proposes moving up elections amid protests
description: Peru’s new President Dina Boluarte gave in to protesters’ demands early Monday, announcing in a nationally televised address she wants to move up elections.

title: Body of soccer journalist Grant Wahl returned to U.S. after death in Qatar
description: The body of American soccer journalist Grant Wahl was returned to the U.S.

title: Mourners gather after teen killed during West Bank raid
description: People gathered in the West Bank city of Jenin for the funeral of a sixteen-year-old girl who was killed during a shootout in an Israeli raid targeting Palestinian suspects. Jana Zakaran was on her roof when she was shot during an exchange of fire. Her family had been searching for her and found her body on the roof of their home after the Israeli troops withdrew, the official Palestinian news agency reported. Israeli authorities said they were aware of the incident and that an investigation was

title: Israeli army kills teen girl in West Bank raid, Palestinians say
description: A Palestinian hospital said Israeli forces killed a teenage girl during an army operation in the occupied West Bank early on Monday.

title: Viktor Bout's victory tour: Freed Russian arms dealer praises Putin and joins ultranationalist party
description: Viktor Bout has received a celebrity's welcome in Russia since the prisoner exchange with Britney Griner, praising Putin's war in Ukraine.

title: South Korea's LGBTQ community confronts crushing headwinds in fight for equality
description: Conservative lawmakers and religious leaders have contributed to activists’ lengthy and unsuccessful attempts to pass a comprehensive nondiscrimination bill.

title: A Lockerbie bombing suspect is in U.S. custody. Here's what to know.
description: The U.S. arrest of Libyan man Abu Agila Mas’ud accused of making the bomb that exploded on board Pan Am Flight 103 in 1988 has renewed attention on the incident.

title: American student goes missing while studying in France
description: Ken Deland Jr., a 21-year-old American college student, was studying in France but hasn’t been heard from in more than two weeks. NBC’s Molly Hunter reports for TODAY.

title: Freed arms dealer Viktor Bout joins Russian ultranationalist party
description: Viktor Bout, the Russian arms dealer freed after 14 years in U.S. custody in exchange for WNBA star Brittney Griner, has joined the Kremlin-loyal ultranationalist Liberal Democratic Party, its leader said on Monday.

title: Russia steps up attacks against Ukraine, targeting power grid
description: As Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy signaled a renewed effort at diplomacy, Russia is stepping up its attacks, targeting the country's electrical grids, causing rolling blackouts and forcing many residents to leave. NBC’s Richard Engel reports for TODAY.

title: Gaza authorities discover over 60 Roman era graves
description: Hamas authorities in Gaza on Sunday announced the discovery of over 60 tombs in an ancient burial site dating back to the Roman era.

title: Iran carries out second known execution over protests
description: Iran on Monday executed a second known prisoner detained and convicted amid nationwide protests challenging the country’s theocracy.

title: American college student reported missing while studying abroad in France
description: American college student Ken DeLand Jr. has been reported missing by his family while studying abroad in France at the University Grenoble Alpes.

title: Beijing residents welcome easing of Covid curbs
description: Long lines formed outside clinics and pharmacies in Beijing as residents reacted to last week's easing of Covid curbs with guarded optimism.

title: How Dutch farmers became the center of a global right-wing culture war
description: Radicalized by conspiracy theories, some far-right activists have supported farmers in the Netherlands in their campaign to stop plans to potentially shut thousands of farms in order to reduce harmful nitrogen emissions.

title: Roman-era tombs uncovered at Gaza Strip housing development
description: Authorities in Gaza on Sunday announced the discovery of over 60 tombs in an ancient burial site dating back to the Roman era.

title: Peru president proposes moving up elections amid deadly unrest
description: Peru’s newest president, Dina Boluarte, gave in to protesters’ demands early Monday announcing that she will send Congress a a proposal to move up elections.

title: ‘I’ll kill you all’: Man kills 3 in Rome condo board meeting
description: A man opened fire Sunday during a condominium board meeting in a coffee shop in northern Rome, killing three people and injuring others, authorities said.

title: Deadly protests in Peru follow ouster of President Pedro Castillo
description: Two teens were killed and four people injured in Peru on Sunday during protests demanding the country hold general elections following the ouster of former President Pedro Castillo, police and local authorities said.

title: China scraps tracking app as it relaxes strict 'zero-Covid' rules
description: China will drop a travel tracing requirement. It is an exit from the strict “zero-Covid” policies that have elicited widespread dissatisfaction and protests.
